VARDESC: I can explain what the condition means to people outside my family who may need to know (e.g., teachers, social workers).
I know who else in my family might be at risk for this condition.
When I think about the condition in my family, I get upset.
I know what I can do to change how this condition affects me/my children.
I am able to make plans for my future.
I can make decisions about the condition that may change my future or my child(ren)’s future.
